page.title: 04Green Belt Area (EK North)
page.content: North of East Kilbride are low hills of about 200m - the Cathkin Braes. This area is designated as Green Belt to separate the New Town from Glasgow. It is mainly used for dairy and beef cattle though some parts are left wild because of bare rock and poor soils. Although the Green Belt should be pre- served as countryside there are some small developments such as Philipshill Hospital built before the Belt was de- signated, electricity pylons crossing fields to College Milton industrial estate, caravan storage on a farm at Kittochside which spoils the view, a cleansing department dump in a disused quarry, and Rolls Royce test beds for the testing of aeroplane engines. Surprisingly, considering the overall level of amenities in the town, there are no recreational facilities in this particular area.
